PIT_ADMIN

Package to administer PIT. Provides methods to create or maintain messages.

Author

Juergen Sieben, ConDeS GmbH

Published under MIT licence

Public Constants
Installation switches

Flags indicate whether the respective functionality should be compiled or not.

C_LEVEL_LE_WARN

Method pit.warn

C_LEVEL_LE_INFO

Method pit.info

C_LEVEL_LE_DEBUG

Method pit.debug

C_LEVEL_LE_ALL

Method pit.log

C_TRACE_LE_MANDATORY

Methods pit.enter_mandatory | pit.leave_mandatory

C_TRACE_LE_OPTIONAL

Methods pit.enter_optional | pit.leave_optional

C_TRACE_LE_DETAILED

Methods pit.enter_detailed | pit.leave_detailed

C_TRACE_LE_ALL

Methods pit.enter | pit.leave

C_GLOBAL_CONTEXT

PIT memory in globally accessible context

Export groups

Target distinguish between areas of similar items to streamline the API

C_TARGET_PMS

Messages

C_TARGET_PTI

Translatable Items

C_TARGET_PAR

Parameters

Administration methods
create_message_package
procedure create_message_package(
p_directory varchar2 default null
)

Procedure to (re-) create package MSG.

If called with no parameter, this procedure creates package MSG based on the actual messages from table pit_message. It automatically maps all custom or oracle errors and creates respective exception variables for them.

If called with a directory name, the package is not created but its DDL is written to the file system for later creation or deployment purposes.

Parameter
p_directory
varchar2

Optional parameter to define a directory object the creation writes to. If NULL, the code is executed immediately.

get_message_text
function get_message_text(
p_pms_name in pit_message.pms_name%type,
p_pms_pml_name in pit_message_language.pml_name%type default null
)
return varchar2

Function to retrieve the text for a given language without replacements.  Is used to review the text of a given message in a desired language

Parameters
p_pms_name
in pit_message.pms_name%type

Name of the message to retrieve the text for

p_pms_pml_name
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Optional Oracle language reference. If NULL, the default language is used.

set_language_settings
procedure set_language_settings(
p_pml_list in pit_util.max_sql_char
)

Method to set default language settings.

Is used to initially set the default language settings.  Precedence is set accoding to the sort order: First languages preceede later languages.

Parameter
p_pml_list
in pit_util.max_sql_char

List of colon-separated language names

Message maintenance methods
merge_message_group
procedure merge_message_group(
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type,
p_pmg_description in pit_message_group.pmg_description%type default null,
p_pmg_error_prefix in pit_message_group.pmg_error_prefix%type default null,
p_pmg_error_postfix in pit_message_group.pmg_error_postfix%type default null
)

Procedure to maintain message groups. Is used to create or change a message group.  Message groups do not have any special meaning other than sorting messages for easier maintenance and export separation.

Optional parameters for error pre/postixes allow for a deviating definition for individual message groups.  This way, packages from other authors can be used without changing the complete package exceptions names.

Parameters
p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Name of the message group

p_pmg_description
in pit_message_group.pmg_description%type

Optional description to describe the message group.

p_pmg_error_prefix
in pit_message_group.pmg_error_prefix%type

Optional prefix for derived exception names from message name.

p_pmg_error_postfix
in pit_message_group.pmg_error_postfix%type

Optional postfix for derived exception names from message name.

merge_message_group
procedure merge_message_group(
p_row in out nocopy pit_message_group%rowtype
)

Procedure to matain a message group. Overload with a row record.

Parameter

p_row  Record of a message group

delete_message_group
procedure delete_message_group(
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type,
p_force in boolean default false
)

Procedure to delete a message group. Does not delete a message group if messages exists within that group, unless specified by setting the <P_FORCE> parameter to true. Will not commit nor re-create the MSG package.

Parameters
p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Name of the message group

p_force
in boolean

Flag to indicate whether deleting this group should delete all messages of this group.  Defaults to FALSE: If messages exists, an error is thrown

merge_message
procedure merge_message(
p_pms_name in pit_message.pms_name%type,
p_pms_text in pit_message.pms_text%type,
p_pms_pse_id in pit_message.pms_pse_id%type,
p_pms_description in pit_message.pms_description%type default null,
p_pms_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type default null,
p_pms_pml_name in pit_message_language.pml_name%type default null,
p_error_number in pit_message.pms_custom_error%type default null
)

Procedure to maintain messages. Is used to create or change a PIT message. Will not commit nor re-create the MSG package.

Parameters
p_pms_name
in pit_message.pms_name%type

Name of the respective pit_message. Must be unique for the default language

p_pms_text
in pit_message.pms_text%type

Message text with replacement anchors in the format #n#, where n is an integer that references up to 50 replacement items

p_pms_pse_id
in pit_message.pms_pse_id%type

Reference to a severity as defined in PIT.LEVEL_<level> constants. Ranges from PIT.LEVEL_FATAL to <PIT.LEVEL_VERBOSE> or 20..70

p_pms_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Optional reference to a message group

p_pms_pml_name
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Optional reference to the Oracle supported language names, if null, the default language is used (as defined in pms_pml_name)

p_error_number
in pit_message.pms_custom_error%type

Optional reference to an Oracle system error number. Must not be a number of an Oracle predefined error number. If null and the severity of the message is in <pit.LEVEL_FATAL>|<pit.LEVEL_ERROR>, then an error number from the range -20999..-20000 is used.

merge_message
procedure merge_message(
p_row in out nocopy pit_message%rowtype
)

Procedure to merge a message. Overload with a row record.

Parameter

p_row  Record  of PIT_MESSAGE%ROWTYPE

delete_message
procedure delete_message(
p_pms_name in pit_message.pms_name%type,
p_pms_pml_name in pit_message_language.pml_name%type default null
)

Procedure to delete a single pit_message. Will delete all translations as well. Is called to remove mistyped or unnecessary messages in all languages. Will not commit nor re-create the MSG package.

Parameters
p_pms_name
in pit_message.pms_name%type

Name of the message to delete

p_pms_pml_name
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Optional language of the message to delete. If null, all translations are deleted, otherwise only the translated message

delete_all_messages
procedure delete_all_messages(
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type default null
)

Procedure to delete all messages. Is called if a new set of messages shall be installed and all old and unneeded messages must be thrown away beforehand. Will not commit nor re-create the MSG package.

Parameter
p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Optional message group to limit deletion to message of this group.

translate_message
procedure translate_message(
p_pms_name in pit_message.pms_name%type,
p_pms_text in pit_message.pms_text%type,
p_pms_pml_name in pit_message_language.pml_name%type,
p_pms_description in pit_message.pms_description%type default null
)

Procedure to translate a given message. Use this procedure as a shortcut for an already existing message, if the only task is to translate it.

Parameters
p_pms_name
in pit_message.pms_name%type

Name of the respective pit_message. Must be unique for the default language

p_pms_text
in pit_message.pms_text%type

Message text with replacement anchors in the format #n#, where n is an integer that references up to 50 replacement items

p_pms_pml_name
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Reference to the Oracle supported language names

p_pms_description
in pit_message.pms_description%type

Optional description to translate the message description

Translatable items maintenance methods

p_row in pit_translatable_item%rowtype
)

Procedure to validate a translatable item

Parameter
p_row
in pit_translatable_item%rowtype

Record of a translatable item

merge_translatable_item
procedure merge_translatable_item(
p_pti_id in pit_translatable_item.pti_id%type,
p_pti_pml_name in pit_message_language.pml_name%type,
p_pti_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type,
p_pti_name in pit_translatable_item.pti_name%type,
p_pti_display_name pit_translatable_item.pti_display_name%type default null,
p_pti_description pit_translatable_item.pti_description%type default null
)

Procedure to create a or change a translatable item. Is used to create or change a translatable item.  Any item may have up to three different text items assotiated with it to allow for short, medium and longer versions of a text item.

Parameters
p_pti_id
in pit_translatable_item.pti_id%type

ID of the translatable item

p_pit_pml_name

Language of the translatable item

p_pti_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Message group of the translatable item

p_pti_name
in pit_translatable_item.pti_name%type

Text of the translatable item

p_pti_display_name
pit_translatable_item.pti_display_name%type

Optional display name of the translatable item

p_pti_description
pit_translatable_item.pti_description%type

Optional description of the translatable item

merge_translatable_item
procedure merge_translatable_item(
p_row in out nocopy pit_translatable_item%rowtype
)

Procedure to merge a translatable item. Overloaded version with a row record

Parameter
p_row
in out nocopy pit_translatable_item%rowtype

delete_translatable_item
procedure delete_translatable_item(
p_pti_id in pit_translatable_item.pti_id%type,
p_pti_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type
)

Procedure to create a or change a translatable item and all its translations.

Parameter

in pit_translatable_item.pti_id%type

ID of the translatable item

p_pti_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Message group of the translatable item

Context maintenance methods
create_context_toggle
procedure create_context_toggle(
p_toggle_name in varchar2,
p_module_list in varchar2,
p_context_name in varchar2,
p_comment in varchar2 default null
)

Procedure to create a context toggle. Is called to have PIT toggle it's context settings based on entering a module or a list of modules. A toggle switches the debug settings if the package or procedure mentioned in the toggle is entered.

Parameters
p_toggle_name
in varchar2

Name of the context toggle. Maximum of 20 byte. Don't use umlauts or special chars

p_module_list
in varchar2

Name of the module to toggle the context for. May be a pipe separated list of modules Two formats are allowed: Name of a package/method or qualified name of a method in a package (without owner)

p_context_name
in varchar2

Name of the context to switch to. Must be an excisting context

p_comment
in varchar2

Optional comment to explain the usage of the toggle

Example

Valid examples for the object list parameter are:

  • MY_PACKAGE|MY_OTHER_PACKAGE.MY_PROC

delete_context_toggle
procedure delete_context_toggle(
p_toggle_name in varchar2
)

Procedure to remove a context toggle

Parameter
p_toggle_name
in varchar2

Name of the context toggle to remove

create_named_context
procedure create_named_context(
p_context_name in varchar2,
p_log_level in number,
p_trace_level in number,
p_trace_timing in boolean,
p_module_list in varchar2,
p_comment in varchar2 default null
)

Procedure to create a named context to control debug settings.

Parameters
p_context_name
in varchar2

Name of the context. Maximum of 20 byte. Don't use umlauts or special chars

p_log_level
in number

Log level of the named context. Allowed values: LOG_LEVEL(10,20..70)

p_trace level

Trace level of the named context. Allowed values: TRACE_LEVEL (10,20..40)

p_trace_timing
in boolean

Flag to indicate whether timing information must be captured

p_module_list
in varchar2

List of colon separated output module names to be used for logging

p_comment
in varchar2

Optional comment to explain the usage of the named context

create_named_context
procedure create_named_context(
p_context_name in varchar2,
p_settings in varchar2,
p_comment in varchar2 default null
)

Procedure to create a named context. Overload for a settings string.

Parameters
p_context_name
in varchar2

Name of the context. Maximum of 20 byte. Don't use umlauts or special chars

p_settings
in varchar2

Settings string in the format LOG_LEVEL(10,20..70)|TRACE_LEVEL (10,20..40)|TRACE_TIMING_FLAG (Y,N)|MODULE_LIST (MODULE_1:MODULE_2)

p_comment
in varchar2

Optional comment to explain the usage of the named context

Example

Valid examples for the settings parameter are:

  • 30|10|N|PIT_TABLE:PIT_MAIL,

  • 70|40|Y|PIT_CONSOLE -If you want to express that no logging should be used, use 10|10|N|

delete_named_context
procedure delete_named_context(
p_context_name in varchar2
)

Procedure to delete a named context

Parameter
p_context_name
in varchar2

Name of the context to delete

Export and translation methods
create_installation_script
procedure create_installation_script(
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type,
p_target in varchar2,
p_script out nocopy clob,
p_target_language in pit_message_language.pml_name%type default null
)

Method to get items of a group as a script of API calls to PIT_ADMIN package.

Call this method to create a script file that can be used to export all items of this particular group as a SQL script file.

Parameters
p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Message group to filter output

p_target
in varchar2

Type of items to translate <C_TARGET_PMS>|<C_TARGET_PTI>|<C_TARGET_PAR>

p_script
out nocopy clob

Out parameter that contains the SQL script created

p_target_language
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Optional target language. Useful, if you need to get all messages in a different default language, if present.

get_installation_script
function get_installation_script(
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type,
p_target in varchar2
)
return clob

Method to get items of a group as a script of API calls to PIT_ADMIN package.

Call this method to create a script file that can be used to export all items of this particular group directly from SQL.

Parameters
p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Message group to filter output

p_target
in varchar2

Type of items to translate <C_TARGET_PMS>|<C_TARGET_PTI>|<C_TARGET_PAR>

Returns

CLOB instance with the installation script

create_translation_xml
procedure create_translation_xml(
p_target_language in pit_message_language.pml_name%type,
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type default null,
p_target in varchar2,
p_file_name in pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_xliff out nocopy xmltype
)

Method to generate an XML file in format XLIFF to translate items.

Call this procedure to create an XLIFF-File that can be used to translate all members of a target type group to a target language.

Parameters
p_target_language
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Oracle supported language name to tranlsate the items to

p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Group to filter the items to translate

p_target
in varchar2

Type of items to translate <C_TARGET_PMS>|<C_TARGET_PTI>

p_file_name
in pit_util.ora_name_type

File name for the XLIFF file (is included into the file)

p_xliff
out nocopy xmltype

Out parameter that contains the XLIFF file created

get_translation_xml
function get_translation_xml(
p_target_language in pit_message_language.pml_name%type,
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type default null,
p_target in varchar2
)
return clob

Method to directly create a translation XLIFF file and return it as CLOB.

Parameters
p_target_language
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Oracle supported language name to tranlsate the items to

p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Group to filter the items to translate

p_target
in varchar2

Type of items to translate <C_TARGET_PMS>|<C_TARGET_PTI>

Returns

CLOB in format XLIFF to be opened and edited by an XLIFF-Editor

apply_translation
procedure apply_translation(
p_xliff in xmltype,
p_target in varchar2
)

Procedure to import translated items into the database.

If provided with a translated XLIFF-Instance, this procedure creates the necessary items for the new language based on it target type.

Parameters
p_xliff
in xmltype

XLIFF-instance with the translated messages

p_target
in varchar2

Type of items to translate <C_TARGET_PMS>|<C_TARGET_PTI>

delete_translation
procedure delete_translation(
p_pml_name in pit_message_language.pml_name%type,
p_target in varchar2
)

Procedure to delete a translation.

Is called to remove all items in the given language and target type. Will not commit.

Parameters
p_pml_name
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Oracle language name of the translation to be removed

p_target
in varchar2

Type of items to translate <C_TARGET_PMS>|<C_TARGET_PTI>

register_translation
procedure register_translation(
p_pml_name in pit_message_language.pml_name%type
)

Method to register a translated message, if not yet registered.

Is called when loading a translation. The translation message is set to one of the available langauges.

Parameter
p_pml_name
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Oracle language name of the translation to register
